body_html:
@domluna no, if you read the code you linked, you can see that tf.gradients is called exactly once, then the results are cached in the model instance (train_function attribute). Calling train_on_batch many times only results in a single call to tf.gradients at the very beginning.

Since Model cannot be modified after being compiled, this cache is never invalidated (unless you recompile the model).

@girving as far as I can tell, no.
